intro: Monechma tettense, commonly known as the Tettens' monechma, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Ericaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central America, particularly in countries like Mexico and Guatemala. The plant is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves and clusters of bell-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and requires a cool, moist environment. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
